messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Hello  from Cancun Mexico  need help
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Ron! thansk for teh assitance, actually  my research is for the  of third moon or cresent moon name  as the samurais refeer to, i once read  the the
messages.messageBody:
Hi Ron!
thansk for teh assitance, actually my research is for the of third moon or cresent moon name as the samurais refeer to, i once read the the samurais belive that the cressent moon was very powerful, and enhanced the samurai's ki, as was used as an ornament on the helmets, ia agree that was not necesarlly afamilly mon nad was much more and ornament. could this help?

thanks



"shogun.uk" <shogun.uk@...> wrote:
Hi Abel

I think that we would need a little more information on the particular device to be able to provide a little guidance. Remember, the device on the helmet was not necessarily a "Mon" - or we would have some strange "Mon" to research!!

Worth checking out "our" web pages... http://www.samurai-archives.com/crest1.html

There are several MOn which portray the crescent moon - depending on the shape, angle and thickness. Families that used such Mon include Okudaira, Amano, Ono, Nonaka, Ohara, Mochizuki, Yamanashi for a start!!

Good luck..

Rod Johnson




----- Original Message -----
From: caroabel2
Sent: Thursday, October 16, 2003 1:28 AM
Subject: [samuraihistory] Hello from Cancun Mexico need help


I AM RESARCHING ABOUT A SAMURAI CREST (MON), "THE THIRD DAY MOON"
OR "THE CRESCENT MOON", THAT WAS WORNE IN SOME HELMETS AND WAS
BELIVE TO PROVIDE STRONG ENERGY "KI" TO THE SAMURAI, AND IF WAS A
FAMILY MOM?

ANY HELP WILL BE VERY APPRECIATED

THANKS
ABEL

messages.msgSnippet: Hi Abel I think that we would need a little more information on the particular device to be able to provide a little guidance. Remember, the device on the
messages.messageBody:
Hi Abel

I think that we would need a little more information on the particular device to be able to provide a little guidance. Remember, the device on the helmet was not necessarily a "Mon" - or we would have some strange "Mon" to research!!

Worth checking out "our" web pages... http://www.samurai-archives.com/crest1.html

There are several MOn which portray the crescent moon - depending on the shape, angle and thickness. Families that used such Mon include Okudaira, Amano, Ono, Nonaka, Ohara, Mochizuki, Yamanashi for a start!!

Good luck..

Rod Johnson
